newsitem.title: USA: DIVING-DUMAIS WINS SECOND TITLE IN TWO DAYS AT U.S. NATIONALS.
newsitem.headline: DIVING-DUMAIS WINS SECOND TITLE IN TWO DAYS AT U.S. NATIONALS.

text.p: California teenager Troy Dumais staked a claim as an early 2000 U.S. Olympic hopeful Saturday by winning his second national title in two days at the USA Diving Senior National Championships.
Dumais, 17, won the 3-metre springboard title over an impressive field of six finalists that included 1996 Olympian David Pichler and past national champions Dean Panaro and Bryan Gillooly.
Dumais had 666.36 points. Pichler, 28, finished a disappointing fifth.

Dumais, who won the 1-metre springboard title Friday night, has won four national titles in two weeks. Last week at the USA Diving Junior Nationals in Austin, Texas, he set the national record (16) by winning the 1- and 3-metre titles.

"I am having a good two weeks," Dumais said. "This is the best I've done in back-to-back meets. It gives me a lot of confidence for the future. Sure, I want to go to the Olympics but a lot can happen between now and then."
Dumais barely missed the 1996 Olympic team when at age 16 he finished third on 3-metre springboard. Only the top two qualify for the Olympics.
It was also the first time in U.S. diving history, a brother tandem finished 1-2. Justin Dumais, 18, Troy's older brother, finished second with 647.73.

In the women's platform, Laura Wilkinson, 19, won her first national title among a crop of new faces. With two-time Olympic bronze medallist Mary Ellen Clark retired, the women's platform competition is wide open.
The top two finishers qualify for the September 10-14 diving World Cup in Mexico City and the world aquatics championships in Perth, Australia, next January. The six-day meet concludes Sunday.
